game.board

Class HexBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.board.Graph
      • game.board.HexBoard

  • public class HexBoard
extends Graph
    Implements the abstract Graph class. Created in C++, migrated to Java. It creates a graph, of degree 6, used to simulate a Hex board game.
    Version:
    1.1, 01.03.2021
    Author:
    Carlos Granados

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HexBoard()
      Generates a void board
      HexBoard(int size)
      Generated a Hex board of the given size.

        Returns:

        Returns:

        public boolean valid(int i)
        Check if the given value is inside the board (row or col)
        Parameters:

      • check_coords

        public CoordBoard check_coords(int i,
                               int j)
        Check if the points i and j make a valid coordinate. If true, returns the new coordinate. Otherwise for a new coordinate.
        Parameters:
        i - x-component of the move
        j - y-component of the move
        Returns:
        valid (i, j)<\code> coordinate

      • check_coords

        public CoordBoard check_coords(int[] ij)
        Check if the two first components of ij make a valid coordinate. If true, returns the new coordinate. Otherwise ask for a new coordinate.
        Parameters:
        ij - array with input coordinates
        Returns:
        valid (i, j)<\code> coordinate

      • print

        public void print()
        Print the hex graph, including the marks for each player, if any. It try first to clean the screen.
        Specified by:
        print in class Graph
